trans-unit.source: Provides a designer canvas, which renders the visual representation of a workflow model as it is being designed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner"></xref> class.

Gets an <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> object that is a collection of services shared between all elements contained in the designer and used to interact between the host and the designer.
Services are published and requested through the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref>.
Context is not guaranteed to be available during initialization, as the data binding may have not yet resolved.
There are two ways to ensure that an editing context is available.
Use <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.ModelChanged>, which executes whenever the model is assigned to, or when the value the property points to is updated.
Subscribe to the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.Context%2A> dependency propertyâ€™s availability using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.Register%2A>.
The editing context for the workflow designer.
Gets the context menu for this designer.
The context menu for the designer.
Gets a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Debug.DebuggerService"></xref> that is used for run-time debugging.
An object that implements <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Debug.IDesignerDebugView"></xref>.
Saves the current state of the workflow to the <xref href="System.WorkflowModel.Design.WorkflowDesigner.Text"></xref> property.
Indicates whether the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)] is in error state.
`true` if the [!INCLUDE[wfd2](~/includes/wfd2-md.md)] is in error state; otherwise, `false`.
Loads a workflow with the specified instance.
The root of the workflow to load.
Loads a workflow from the XAML contained in the specified file.
The file name of the XAML file.
Loads a workflow from the XAML contained in the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.Text"></xref> property.
Represents the event handler that goes into effect when something in the workflow model changes.
Gets the outline view of the workflow designer.
The outline view of the workflow designer.
Sets the font and color data for the property inspector in a serialized, dictionary format.
The property inspector is commonly known as the property grid.
The font and color data for the property inspector in a serialized, dictionary format.
Gets the property inspector, which is commonly known as the property grid.
The property inspector.
Saves the workflow to an XAML file.
The file name of the XAML file.
Gets or sets the XAML string representation of the workflow.
Before getting this value, call <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.Flush%2A> to convert the current workflow to text.
After setting this value, call <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.Load%2A> to load the XAML into the workflow.
The XAML string representation of the workflow.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner.Text"></xref> property value changes.
Gets a UI element that allows the user to view and edit the workflow visually.
This UI element is commonly referred to as the workflow canvas.
A UI element that allows the user to view and edit the workflow visually.
